tagrelator.pmi
Class PMI

java.lang.Object
  tagrelator.pmi.PMI

public class PMI
extends java.lang.Object

provides the computation of PMI values.
a method for computing PMI values for a single word
a method for computing PMI values for all word all at once
a method for computing a mean PMI value for a pair of words, using the words as each others context

the computation follows the Equation for PMI in the paper
"Second Order Co-occurrence PMI for Determining the Semantic Similarity of Words" from

Author:
Aminul Islam, Diana Inkpen
at time of programming available at http://hnk.ffzg.hr/bibl/lrec2006/pdf/242_pdf.pdf

          multiply the corpussize with this factor useful for Flickr Data since real Corpussize is unknown

Method Detail

pmiSingle

public java.util.TreeSet<PMIvalue> pmiSingle(java.lang.String aWord,
                                             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> contextFreqs,
                                             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> wordFreqs,
                                             long corpusSize)
computes the PMI values for one word and all of its context words

Parameters:
aWord - the word as String
contextFreqs - the joint frequencies of the word and its context words,
be sure to put the the right contextFreq for aWord in there
wordFreqs - the independent word frequencies of all words in the corpus
corpusSize - the size of the used corpus in words
Returns:
a TreeMap sorted in descending oder by PMI values

pmiAll

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.TreeSet<PMIvalue>> pmiAll(RawCounts someRawCounts)
computes PMI values for words that are keys in the context map of the RawCounts parameter.

Parameters:
someRawCounts - Frequency counts which can be read in by the FlickrReader and CorpusReader classes from the according files
Returns:
a map from words to Sets of PMIvalues , which contain the context word and the computed PMI value of type Double

pmiPair

public WordPair pmiPair(WordPair aPair,
                        RawCounts someCounts)
computes the mean PMI value of a pair of words, in that it computes the PMI for w2 as context for w1 and the other way around, resulting PMI is half of the sum of the two

Parameters:
aPair - a WordPair object
someCounts - a RawCounts object, which at least has to contain the independent frequencies of the words in the wordpair and their joint frequencies.
Returns:
the methods sets the pmi member variable of the WordPair object and returns it

pmiFormula

private java.lang.Double pmiFormula(java.lang.String aterm,
                                    java.lang.String aContextword,
                                    java.lang.Integer freqTerm,
                                    java.lang.Integer freqCont,
                                    java.lang.Integer aJointFreq,
                                    long cSize)
implementation of the formula for the PMI, have a look in class description, or source code, to get more information about the formula

lb

private double lb(java.lang.Double x)
computes logarithm to base 2 of x

selftest

public void selftest(java.lang.String fileName)
to validate the correctness of the PMI computation
results get printed out on console

Parameters:
fileName - name of a plaintext file containing a comma separated list which is structured as follows
the first line of the file should be size in words of the corpus from which the data stems
following lines
word, idependent frequency of word, context word, idependent frequency of context word, joint frequency, pmi value
